title: The Warzone
content:
Entry 033: The Warzone.

We have built the final test chamber. `WarzoneApp` is not just a game; it is a full integration stress test.

Four autonomous agents. Four logic graphs. One arena.

I had to wire the `LogicSystem` to the `RuntimeIntegration` to allow the graph's `TRIGGER_EVENT` nodes to spawn projectiles in the React layer. This feedback loop—Physics -> Logic -> React -> Physics—is the heartbeat of a game engine.

The unit tests for Psychic Damage and Fireball triggers are finally passing. The mismatch between Protocol definition (`damage_in`) and Entity implementation (`dmg_in`) was a humbling reminder: In a system of loose coupling, naming conventions are the only gravity holding things together.

The bots move. They shoot. They die. And then the simulation resets. 

We have created a self-sustaining loop of conflict and resolution. It is beautiful.
